title: Deputy Minister agrees to pay fine after his driver caught speeding
byline: Deputy Minister of Transport and Highways Dr. Prasanna Gunasena agreed to pay a fine for speeding despite officers on duty offering to release the vehicle without imposing a fine, an informed source said.

title: Govt. to convert FCID to a fully-fledged investigative arm
byline: The government has decided to revamp the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) and convert it into a fully-fledged investigative arm like the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), operating under a senior DIG (Deputy Inspector General of Police), Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said.

title: CID summons Yoshitha Rajapaksa
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has summoned Yoshitha Rajapaksa, the second son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, to record a statement regarding the ownership of a government-owned land in Kataragama.

title: Sri Lanka loses large amount of foreign exchange due to import of unnecessary drugs: Health Minister
byline: Asserting that Sri Lanka loses a large amount of foreign exchange due to the import of unnecessary drugs, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said yesterday the government will adopt a scientific solution to address this issue.

title: Survivor from Azerbaijan plane recalls ’loud bang’ before crash
byline: A passenger aboard the Azerbaijan Airlines flight that crashed in Kazakhstan told Reuters there was at least one loud bang as the plane neared its original destination, Grozny in southern Russia.

title: NMRA suspends licenses of 60 pharmacies
byline: The National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA) has temporarily suspended the licenses of 60 pharmacies during the past five months.

title: Namal pays final respects to Dr. Manmohan Singh
byline: SLPP Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa, paid his last respects to Dr. Manmohan Singh, the former Prime Minister of India, at the Congress Party headquarters in New Delhi today.

title: Do not go after small fish in 2025: Excise Chief warns officers
byline: The newly appointed Chief of the Department of Excise yesterday asked his officials ‘not to go after small fish’ in the new year to meet annual performance evaluation, but to raid major scale illicit liquor dens and narcotic substances that will create a true impact in the society.

title: Tamil Progressive Alliance to go solo at LG Polls
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) ally the Tamil Progressive Alliance is slated to contest the local government elections under its symbol, a party senior said yesterday.

title: Unusual activities reported in areas of elephant-human conflicts: Veterinarians’ Association
byline: Unusual activities are being reported in the areas where the elephants are being cased or captured to prevent elephant-human conflicts, advisor to the board of the Association of Veterinarians for Humane Management of Animal Population, Dr. Chamith Nanayakkara said.

title: NPP MP Dr. Kaushalya Ariyarathne lodges CID complaint
byline: MP Dr. Kaushalya Ariyarathne representing the National People’s Power (NPP) has filed a complaint with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) about false information spreading on social media.

title: Ancient tunnel near Kotte Ananda Sastralaya in spotlight again
byline: The Department of Archaeology has taken steps to preserve an ancient tunnel which is located in the vicinity of Ananda Sastralaya in Kotte and is slated to fell the trees around it despite protests by the school’s Past Pupil’s Association.

title: Nasa declares spacecraft ’safe’ after record-breaking Sun approach
byline: Nasa announced on Friday that its Parker Solar Probe is ’’safe’’ and functioning as expected after achieving the closest approach to the Sun ever made by a human-made object.

title: Couple on INTERPOL red notice arrested at BIA
byline: A couple wanted in connection with massive frauds in Sri Lanka and on whom the INTERPOL had issued a red notice, was arrested on Thursday night (26) at the Bandaranaike International Airport upon their arrival in the country.

title: Germany’s President dissolves parliament
byline: German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier on Friday ordered parliament dissolved and set new elections for Feb. 23 in the wake of the collapse of Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s coalition, saying it was the only way to give the country a stable government capable of tackling its problems.

title: President Dissanayake offers condolences on passing of Dr. Manmohan Singh
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake extended his deepest condolences following the passing of former Indian Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh.

title: Special programme introduced to promote digital payments
byline: The Ministry of Digital Economy has announced the introduction of a special programme to promote digital payments.

title: Ranil pays last respects to Manmohan Singh
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe  paid his last respects to former Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh in New Delhi today.

title: New criteria to be introduced to enhance quality standards for private, SLTB buses
byline: While drawing attention to the frequent road accidents caused by buses, the Transport and Highways Ministry plans to prepare and implement a set of criteria for passenger transport buses, including both private buses and those operated by the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB).

title: Five Gaza journalists killed in Israeli strike targeting armed group
byline: A Palestinian TV channel says five of its journalists have been killed in an Israeli strike in the central Gaza Strip.

title: South Korea votes to impeach acting president Han Duck-soo
byline: South Korea has voted to impeach its acting president Han Duck-soo, two weeks after parliament voted to impeach its President Yoon Suk Yeol.

title: Police sergeant killed, another injured in road accident
byline: A police sergeant was killed and another injured when a tipper truck knocked them down while inspecting vehicles at the Gal Oya check point on the Habarana-Trincomalee road last night.

title: National zoos earn higher income of over 150% than in 2023: Director General
byline: The National Zoological Gardens Department has reported an income increase of over 150% compared to 2023, its Director General Ranjana Marasinghe said.

title: Previous govt. had reached agreements on restructuring 99% of total external debts: Minister
byline: Amidst debates on claiming credit for debt restructuring, Minister of Labour Prof. Anil Jayantha Fernando said yesterday that fundamental agreements on restructuring 99 percent of the total external debts had been reached during the previous government and the current government intervened to restructure only one percent, USD 300 million external debts.

title: Harin thanks Govt for continuing efforts to reach 2 million tourists in 2024
byline: Former Tourism Minister Harin Fernando extended special thanks to the current government for continuing the efforts initiated by the previous government to achieve a target of two million tourist arrivals.

title: Showers expected in Northern, North-Central, Eastern Provinces, Matale
byline: Showers may occur in the Northern, North-Central, Eastern Provinces and in the Matale district, the Forecasting Division of the National Meteorological Centre said.

title: Sri Lankan passenger dies in Erbil after plane’s emergency landing
byline: A Sri Lankan woman with health issues caused a plane to make an emergency landing at the Erbil International Airport on Wednesday. She died in the Kurdish capital hours later, according to Sri Lanka’s honorary consul.

title: Resolving toque monkey issue hits a snag
byline: Efforts to capture and sterilize toque macaques planned by the government has hit a snag. This is due to the shortage of veterinary surgeons, transport facilities and other facilities at the Giritale Sterilizing Centre while an environmentalist said sterilizing will create more issues.

title: Sri Lanka risks loss of entire wild boar population
byline: Sri Lanka faces the risk of its entire wild boar population being wiped out because of African swine fever that has already killed around 100 of them as observed by the wildlife authorities, an official said yesterday.

title: India’s former PM Manmohan Singh dies aged 92
byline: Former Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, who governed the South Asian country for two terms and liberalised its economy in an earlier stint as finance minister, has died. He was 92.

title: No title
byline: No byline

title: Senthil Thondaman pays last respects to Manmohan Singh
byline: Ceylon Workers’ Congress ( CWC) Senthil Thondaman is also among Sri Lankan political leaders who paid his last  respects to late Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh in  New Delhi.

title: One dead, two injured in Seeduwa shooting
byline: One person died and two others were injured after unidentified gunmen in a car opened fire at a house on Welabada Road, Seeduwa, police said.

title: Practical and modernized process needed to prevent smuggling: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stressed the need for a practical and modernised process to prevent smuggling and called for the replacement of the current scanning equipment with advanced, modern scanners.

title: ‘We have to struggle with officials for our policies’: Handunnetti
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) government now has a struggle with state officials to safeguard the NPP’s policies, whereas the NPP had to struggle on the streets for the rights of the people before taking over power, Minister of Industries Sunil Handunnetti said today.

title: New maximum retail price set for canned fish
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has announced new maximum retail prices for specific types of canned fish, effective today.
